name: Sol Rio de Luna y Mares

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for two weeks from 27 September 2007, booking with Thomas cook. We paid £689 each for an all inclusive stay including flights and transfers.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel based on what we paid - a bargain

likes.liked: — The beach and big bed in the room
likes.disliked: — ok for us but no nightlife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a young couple (Mid twenties) on a budget just starting out in life and our careers so had to be careful with expense. This to us was a great holiday and a really great way to escape our troubles for a fortnight.
reviews.title: Wonderful Relaxing Vacation

reviews.text: For what we paid it was well worth it! Obviously if we paid more (lets say £1000 - we may not be as impressed but would still see it as good value)
reviews.title: great place
nice resorst amazing beach!
reviews.text: The Beach:
Lovely. CLEAR BLUE TURQUOISE (SP) WATERS. White sand, powder like. Very clean beach - no motorised sports was a bit disappointed at first but I guess that’s why the beach is so clean.
reviews.title: Great resort for families with baby

reviews.text: The Sol Rio de Lunas y Mares beat anywhere I have stayed in the Caribbean hands down.
reviews.title: Tropical, Flavourful, Wonderful!

likes.liked: — Smiling staff - genuinely friendly and loving their jobs and their guests
likes.disliked: — Our bed was like Mount Everest - tall in the middle and receding towards the sides

reviews.text: Only the Sol Rio de Lunas side was open when we arrived on May 26, 2007, and it was raining (a LOT the week we were there), but we couldn't have possibly had a better time. The entertainment staff constantly had something on the go - from games and sports, to Cuban culture and dancing, to Opera singing and spectacular dance performances. The evening shows were a little comical at times, but were performed with such vibrance, energy and enthusiasm, everyone was smiling and cheering by the second song.
reviews.title: It was the Caribbean dream!

likes.liked: — The comfortable bed, the amazing spa and the proximity to the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach rivals some of the best we've visited. The rooms were clean, renovated and modern. There was a really cool electronic safe in the room. There was always available horseback riding, watersports (catamarans, windsurfers, pedal boats, kayaks - all with free lessons or "captains"). All equipment was in great condition - I would, however, recommend taking your own snorkeling gear - limited sizes of flippers/fins. The landscape was lush, green, floral and naturally beautiful.
reviews.title: WOW! amazing!

likes.liked: — The beach and food- lots of variety
likes.disliked: — not much oppertunity for shopping, but not really needed anyway

reviews.text: The staff was superb. They were friendly, smiling, accomodating and welcoming. They all really seemed to be enjoying their jobs. There was a little kitten that the animacion staff had adopted - they put a little bracelet collar on him, fed him, played with him and named him "Salvatore". They encouraged us to feed the couple of stray cats that we saw only one evening. What a nice feeling that generated. I want to go back.
reviews.title: Amazing trip! Beautiful ground!

likes.liked: — The spa and the size of the resort

reviews.text: The food was flavourful and plentiful. Need I say more?
reviews.title: Great time at the Mares

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sol Rio de Luna y Mares February 2007for 1 week, and can't say enough about this resort! We travelled with family who had stayed at this resort last March, and couldn't be more happy with their suggestion. The staff were beyond frendly, the beach was amazing, not to mention, went on forever.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

likes.liked: — The staff, Ivan, Francco, Vladamere and Yuri

reviews.text: Excellent food, bars and restraunts available at all areas of the resort, no treking back and forth. A la carte meals were amazing, the staff went out of their way to ensure you had a great time.
reviews.title: Planning our next visit

likes.liked: — Spacious quiet room and lots of windows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach never felt crowded, staff were quick to locate a lounger and position it just to your likings. The beach was always clean, nice even walk into the water, and no seaweed to be found. Walk to the end of the beach (to the right at the base of the next resort) and you can snorkel about 10 meters off the beach and see beautiful coral and many many fish. We found taking a banana from breakfast with you and the fish will swarm around you.
reviews.title: Great week!

reviews.text: There is a zoo which you can bicycle to within 2 minutes, very short wait (if any) for any of the activity equipment, beautiful gardens, you name it, Sol Rio de Luna y Mares has it!
reviews.title: Needs alot of TLC

reviews.text: There is a vendor market which is open everyday in Guadalavacca, a $5/5 minute taxi off the resort where you can find lots of local merchants aswell as a beautiful public beach.
reviews.title: needs some tlc

likes.liked: — needs to be renovated and a lot of tlc

reviews.text: Hi ,
reviews.title: Such a pleasure walking in the aprk and beach

likes.liked: — THE SMELL OF THE PARK IN THE MORNING

reviews.title: wouldn't recommend
reviews.text: We Spent two week (me and my girlfriend) in this hotel and my comment is simply : do not believe in all the bad review…this resort is just fantastic!

reviews.title: A Great Week in Cuba!
reviews.text: We had a fantastic time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Is a resort located in a fantastic park between a lagoon and a fantastic beach, the best in guardalavaca, nothing to compare with the other beaches around that we personally visit to compare.
reviews.title: loved this resort

reviews.text: Here my review of the hotel .
reviews.title: beware First Air...

aka: Sol Rio De Luna y Mares Hotel Guardalavaca
description: Four -Star All Inclusive Resort with 464 rooms. Located beachfront in Playa Esmeralda, on the northern coast of Holguin province, where visitors will be amazed by the dazzling superposition of blues and greens from the sea, sky and costal shrubbery. This hotel complex is surrounded by extensive green areas and offers a wide variety of services and attractions. Recommended for families, weddings, honeymoons and tourist groups.Guest Rooms464 rooms: 308 Standard, 108 Standard Ocean View, 30 Standard Superior Ocean View, 6 Junior Suite, 4 Suite, 8 Family Suite Ocean ViewDining7 Restaurants (A la Carta, Buffet), 6 Bars
